oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from G. W. Gordon to Capt. A. R. Gordon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: CSA Gen. G. W. Gordon, imprisoned at Ft. Warren, Mass., writes to his cousin Andrew at Johnson's Island Prison. He considers the war over and "our cause is a failure." The general recognizes Andrew's devotion to the cause and advises him to return home soon even if it is humiliating. George Washington Gordon joined the 11th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA, as a drillmaster. After the war, he became a member of the KKK in Pulaski and served in the Tennessee General Assembly.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
